basics.name: Solis Winters
basics.summary: A Health Policy PhD Candidate at UC Berkeley, with research interests in maternal and child health, HIV, causal inference, and impact evaluation

education.institution: University of California, Berkeley School of Public Health
education.area: Graduate Certificate in Applied Data Science
education.studyType: PhD, Health Policy, Population & Data Science

education.institution: Saint Louis University College for Public Health and Social Justice
education.area: Minors in Engineering Mathematics and Urban Poverty Studies
courses: Biostatistics Capstone: 'The black-white disparities in preterm birth rates in St. Louis City and County'
Honors Program Capstone: 'Understanding the role of social support among low food-secure adults in Missouri'

publications.summary: Please find a complete list of publications [here](https://soliswinters.github.io/publications).

research.name: University of California, Berkeley School of Public Health
research.summary: Lead data management, monitoring, and statistical analysis for a cluster randomized control trial to test whether cash incentives can improve treatment adherence among people living with HIV in Tanzania.

research.name: International Initiative for Impact Evaluation (3ie)
research.summary: Led the analysis for the impact evaluation of a nutrition randomized trial in Baja Verapaz, Guatemala and assisted with development of the manuscript.

research.name: University of California, San Francisco School of Nursing
research.summary: Wrote, updated, and revised R Markdown code to generate monthly, tailored reports based on customer feedback data for drug shop owners enrolled in a randomized controlled trial in Tanzania.

research.name: International Initiative for Impact Evaluation (3ie)
research.summary: Synthesized evidence around key questions for policymakers in the Philippines as they prepared to respond to challenges posed by COVID-19.

research.name: Inter-American Development Bank, Office of Strategic Planning and Development Effectiveness
research.summary: Provided technical support for impact evaluations and research in maternal and child health and nutrition.

research.name: Saint Louis University College for Public Health and Social Justice
research.summary: Interviewed parents for a qualitative research study to understand the relationship between sleep habits and health among young children in St. Louis.

research.name: American Institutes for Research
research.summary: Assisted in the evaluation of Plantwise Kenya, a project focused on improving plant health in Kenya by training extension agents and expanding farmer access to plant health information.

awards.title: Outstanding Bachelor of Science in Biostatistics Graduating Senior Award
awards.awarder: Saint Louis University College for Public Health and Social Justice
awards.summary: This award honors and individual that shows leadership performance & potential, scholastic achievement, and manifestations of the College Covenant in personal conduct.'

certificates.name: Graduate Certificate in Applied Data Science
certificates.issuer: University of California, Berkeley School of Information

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine
